limit_definition.gloss: the value a function approaches as the input approaches a point
limit_definition.exec: lambda f, x, a, h: f(a + h)

difference_quotient.gloss: the average rate of change of a function over an interval
difference_quotient.exec: lambda f, x, h: (f(x + h) - f(x)) / h

derivative_definition.gloss: the instantaneous rate of change of a function
derivative_definition.formula: lim (f(x + h) - f(x)) / h as h -> 0
derivative_definition.exec: lambda f, x, h: (f(x + h) - f(x)) / h

power_rule.gloss: the derivative of a power function

derivative_constant.gloss: the derivative of a constant is zero

derivative_linear.gloss: the derivative of a linear function

derivative_sum.gloss: the derivative of a sum is the sum of the derivatives
derivative_sum.exec: lambda f, g, x, h: ((f(x + h) - f(x)) / h) + ((g(x + h) - g(x)) / h)

derivative_product_rule.gloss: the derivative of a product of two functions
derivative_product_rule.exec: lambda f, g, x, h: ((f(x + h) - f(x)) / h) * g(x) + f(x) * ((g(x + h) - g(x)) / h)

derivative_quotient_rule.gloss: the derivative of a quotient of two functions

derivative_chain_rule.gloss: the derivative of a composite function
derivative_chain_rule.exec: lambda f, g, x, h: ((f(g(x + h)) - f(g(x))) / h)

derivative_exponential.gloss: the derivative of the natural exponential function

derivative_logarithm.gloss: the derivative of the natural logarithm

antiderivative_power_rule.gloss: the antiderivative of a power function

antiderivative_exponential.gloss: the antiderivative of the natural exponential function

riemann_sum_left.gloss: a left endpoint Riemann sum approximation of area
riemann_sum_left.exec: lambda f, xs, dx: sum(f(x) * dx for x in xs)

riemann_sum_right.gloss: a right endpoint Riemann sum approximation of area
riemann_sum_right.exec: lambda f, xs, dx: sum(f(x) * dx for x in xs)

definite_integral_approx.gloss: an approximation of the definite integral using Riemann sums
definite_integral_approx.exec: lambda f, xs, dx: sum(f(x) * dx for x in xs)

fundamental_theorem_of_calculus.gloss: the theorem connecting differentiation and integration
